thread.title: Mazda recalls 2, 3, and 6 models after seat defect found
thread.title_full: Mazda recalls 2, 3, and 6 models after seat defect found | Daily Telegraph

author: Keagan Elder
title: Mazda recalls 2, 3, and 6 models after seat defect found
text:
THREE popular Mazda models have been recalled after a defect was found.
If you own a Mazda built between September 4, 2007 and March 28, 2012 you might want to book in an inspection following a recall of a number of models.
The recall comes on the same day as the latest version of the Mazda6 was named judges’ choice winner in Australia’s Best Cars awards.
The Mazda2 (DE), Mazda3 (BL) and Mazda6 (GH) were all found to have the same defect.
media_camera Mazda 3 models built from 2007 to 2012 have been recalled.
It was found the seat height adjuster lifter link may crack or the lifter link retaining nuts may separate in the three Mazda models.These defects may cause abnormal noise or rattling.
In the worst case, the lifter link may separate from the seat frame and cause the seat to move out of position.
If you own one of these Mazda models, Mazda Australia will contact all affected owners by mail.
Owners are advised to present their car to a Mazda dealer for a free inspection and repair.
If you need any more information, contact your nearest Mazda dealer or visit the ACCC website.
Originally published as Mazda recalls thousands of cars
